text: Hi there! Is Instarem Amaze + Mastercard the best way to make a large foreign currency (USD) payment? Tq
UOB lady's with the selected category
depends on what is your foreign merchant mcc

Hi gurus  I have a UOB one card and absolute amex on the way  if I occasionally want to spend in JB (Ringgit)  online spend (USD) and Thailand (THB). Which currency card should I apply for for these 3 currencies.1. Amaze?2. Youtrip?3. Other recommendation?Thank you!
Wait  what?What "currency card" should I apply for these 3 currencies? What does that mean?
It sounds like you are implying each currency will get its own card. That's not the case. You just have the opportunity to open multiple wallets for different currencies

And each wallet is linked to just a single cardThe benefit of holding money in the respective wallets is that you are holding them at a particular rate. But this shouldn't really either be considered a pro or a con because FX is volatile and unpredictable. Unless you have a strong feeling that a particular currency will strengthen vs others...?

Fwiw  i feel all the multicurrency cards are all about the same (especially in terms of rate). There are plenty of comparisons online.For amaze I suppose you mean amaze wallet (since you have no mastercards)  they give 1% in form of points for fx txns. Cannot store myr.Youtrip cannot store myr and thb (i think).Other recommendation is probably Revolut because you can withdraw money out (the rest are all stuck inside)To store myr u need ichange (but I usually transfer to tng wallet because ichange app is... buggy)
SDIC doesn't cover privileged banking accounts  IIRC

I generally feel multi currency wallets are overrated  for the following reasons1) SGD is not a "shit" currency (i.e. Leaving your SGD in your bank account  even if earning 0% interest  is no worse than holding MYR and earning 5% p.a. on it)2) you don't have a crystal ball that can help you predict whether a particular currency is likely to go up or down vs other currencies3) even if you did  there is opportunity cost in holding a currency (or anything  for that matter)4) piggybacking off the example above  what actually is the benefit in holding a currency vs SGD  considering the general strength and stability of SGD? Imagine you "hold" MYR to lock in the rate. You go in 3 months and you've lost 2%. Of course it can go the other way  but hence why I said #2What's more important? Good FX rates with low spread  low fees/surcharges

Yes I do meant e-wallets. I do have a debit FX with Mastercard as well. Does topping up with the Mastercard have any benefits? Or can I top up using UOB one card to clock the 2k spend or absolute to get the 1.7% cash back?
Most e-wallets don't allow top up from Amex so using absolute isn't even an option
You only have that option for grab. And UOB absolute only pays 0.3% on grab top ups

Last transaction was 5411 ( Jan 29)
Did you exceed $1k spend within current statement month?
not sure if this helps but i obtained full points for 5411 on Jan 27
Ohhh  guess I call up the bank and check w them
you calculate using excel right the distribution of points?
Then I have no idea why it rejects  if it is JAL website. Perhaps chat assist with UOB to see any decline transaction.
Suggest you do one more grocery transaction on next Monday n check on tue or wed again.
